name: Introduction to Comparative Politics
imgAltText: A statue of a headless warrior towers over a city on fire, some of its structures damaged and its residents in havoc.
description: This course examines why democracy emerges and survives in some countries rather than in others; how political institutions affect economic development; and how American politics compares to that of other countries. It reviews economic, cultural, and institutional explanations for political outcomes. It also includes case studies of politics in several countries. Assignments include several papers of varying lengths and extensive structured and unstructured class participation.
descriptionHtml: This course examines why democracy emerges and survives in some countries rather than in others; how political institutions affect economic development; and how American politics compares to that of other countries. Assignments include several papers of varying lengths and extensive structured and unstructured class participation.
